original: Högberg, Folke, generalmajor, Skövde, f. 20/3/84 i Hälsingborg av postmäst. Knut H. o. Anna Borg. G. 09 m. Ellen Johanson. Barn: Karin f. 10, g. m. gen :konsiul Stemer Vogt, Kairo, Anne-Marie 14, Eva 22. — Mog:ex. 03, off :ex. 05, KHS 12. Und:-Jöjtn. v. Kronob. reg. 05, ilöjtn. 08, v. gen istaben 17, kapt. där s. å., v. Göta Hvg. 23, åter v. gen:staben 25, major där 26, öv:löjtn. 30, överste 35, gen:-major 37. I arméförd. stab 17-21, lär. i krigshist. v. KHS 22-26, sekr. h. isakjk. f. ny inskrivn :förordn. m. fil. värnpl :författn. 25-26, stabschef v. I. (södra) arméförd. 26-30, souschef i lantförsv. kommandoexp. 30-32, chef f. KHS 32, f. Västernorrl. reg. 35, kom-mend. i Bodens fästn. 37, chef f. gen:-stabskåren o. arméstaben 40, mil :be-fälh. i Hl. mil :omr. sed. 42. Insp. f. Sollefteå samrealsk. 36-37, ordf. i lokalstyr. f. Bodens dito 37-40, ordf. i komm. ang. statl. gymn. i Boden 38- 40. KmstkSO, RNO, RVO, FFrKlkl m sv o. ekl, E0K3kl, KFinlVRO, KNS:tOO, OffFrSvSO, RDDO, RR-KrO, FSftjk, Landst:GM, FAKGM, LKrVA.
translated: Högberg, Folke, Major General, Skövde, born March 20th, 1884 in Hälsingborg to Postmaster Knut H. and Anna Borg. Married in 1909 to Ellen Johanson with three children: Karin (born 1910) who married Consul Stemer Vogt in Cairo, Anne-Marie (born 1914), and Eva (born 1922). Graduated from military school in 1903 and officer school in 1905. Attended Krigshögskolan (military academy) from 1908-1912. Served as an under-lieutenant in Kronoberg regiment in 1905, lieutenant in 1908, assistant to the Chief of General Staff in 1917, captain in the same year, and assistant to Göta Hvg in 1923. Returned to the General Staff in 1925 as a major, promoted to lieutenant colonel in 1930, then colonel in 1935 and Major General in 1937. Worked in the Army Headquarters from 1917-1921 and was a teacher of military history at Krigshögskolan from 1922-1926. Became the Secretary of War in 1925 and worked with the Armed Forces' Command Staff with the rank of lieutenant colonel from 1926-1930. Served as the deputy chief of the Defense Command from 1930-1932 and was then appointed as the head of Krigshögskolan in 1932. Became the head of Västernorrl. regiment in 1935 before moving to Boden Fortress in 1937. Became the head of the General Staff Corps and the Army Staff in 1940 and the Military Commander in Hl. military district from 1942. Served as an inspector for Sollefteå high school from 1936-1937 and was the chairman of the local committee for Boden between 1937-1940. Also served as chairman of the committee regarding a state gymnasium in Boden between 1938-1940. Received many awards, including KmstkSO, RNO, RVO, FFrKlkl m sv o. ekl, E0K3kl, KFinlVRO, KNS:tOO, OffFrSvSO, RDDO, RR-KrO, FSftjk, Landst:GM, FAKGM, and LKrVA.

structured.name: Folke Högberg
